page.title: 10OUTSIDER FAMILY
page.content: The Barlows moved from Stourport to Apperley about 10 years ago basically because Mr Barlow had found a better job in Gloucester. They also wanted to live in the quiet countryside and the house, formerly the Apperley village primary school, was in the right place and in the right price range. There are many disadvantages as well as advantages about living in Apperley. There is a good bus service, tennis courts, an excellent Primary school and three churches. There is also a shop but sometimes the produce is expensive. Except for younger children,there is little entertainment in Apperley which is a great pity because the village has great potential. Even the new Village Hall may not suitable for the community which designed it. A car and money to facilitate escape is vital for sanity.
